docs.snippet: In consequence of some dissatisfaction at the management of the Medical Department of Bowdoin College, Edward R. Peaslee, Professor of Surgery, and Charles A. Lee, Professor of Materia Medica, have resigned their Professorships, and it is stated,...
docs.lead_paragraph: In consequence of some dissatisfaction at the management of the Medical Department of Bowdoin College, Edward R. Peaslee, Professor of Surgery, and Charles A. Lee, Professor of Materia Medica, have resigned their Professorships, and it is stated, upon good authority, that Prof. William Sweeter will resign his office at the expiration of the present term. An effort is to be made, as matters now stand, to remove the school to Portland, which may be successful.

headline.main: SANITARY SCIENCE.; A CRUSADE AGAINST CORSETS AND CRINOLINE, BY DR. E.Y. ROBBINS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. E.Y. ROBBINS delivered a lecture last week at Clinton Hall, before an appreciative audience, on the operations of air, light and costume upon the health of the female sex. He advocated the improvement of woman's health as a certain means of improving the race. He found a great deal of fault with the costume of the ladies.

headline.main: The Case of Williams The Other Side.

docs.snippet: The examination of the Chinaman, "Jackaloo," charged with the murder of Jonathan and Josiah Leete, on board the sloop Spray, of Guilford, Conn., was resumed yesterday morning before United States Commissioner J.P. VROOM and Recorder BEDFORD, at...

headline.main: LAW REPORTS.; THE MURDERS ON THE SLOOP SPRAY. Examination of the Chinaman Continued More Bloody Proofs Discovered on Board the Vessel.

docs.lead_paragraph: The examination of the Chinaman, "Jackaloo," charged with the murder of Jonathan and Josiah Leete, on board the sloop Spray, of Guilford, Conn., was resumed yesterday morning before United States Commissioner J.P. VROOM and Recorder BEDFORD, at Jersey City. The excitement was as great as ever, and the Court-room was filled during the greater part of the day.

docs.snippet: We recently called attention to the fact that, as compared with Philadelphia, the mortality of New-York is 9,600 annually in excess of what it would be had we an equally efficient Health Department. This annual aggregate of deaths gave 200 as the...
docs.lead_paragraph: We recently called attention to the fact that, as compared with Philadelphia, the mortality of New-York is 9,600 annually in excess of what it would be had we an equally efficient Health Department. This annual aggregate of deaths gave 200 as the weekly, and about 27 as the daily excess of deaths.

headline.main: FROM ALBANY.; Seven City Railroad Bills Ordered to a Third Reading. A MINIATURE GRIDIRON. SENATE. ASSEMBLY. EVENING SESSION. WHAT THE LEGISLATURE IS DOING. THE DEAF AND DUMB--WHAT WE PAY FOR STATIONERY--THE PRO-RATA BILL IN THE SENATE--THE NEW-YORK CITY RAILRAODS--THE INSITUATION FOR THE BLIND--THE TEN GOVERNORS--DISTINGUISHED NEW-YORKERS IN THELOBBY.

docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, Wednesday, March 28. Petitions were presented for the location of the City Hall in Madison-square, New-York.

headline.main: EUROPE AND AMERICA.; Speech of General Pierce on England and European Affairs.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the island of Nassau, on the 9th inst., a splendid dinner was given to the Colonial Secretary, Hon. C.R. NESBITT, who has just been appointed to another post, and is soon to leave the island. Among the guests present was Ex-President PIERCE, whose health was proposed, and who made in reply the following speech:
